subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 3
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
I really doubt a Ghost Box is capable of remote viewing.

F-S

On Fri, Jul 30, 2010 at 1:07 PM, rasterer <rasterer@...> wrote:

>
>
>
> This experiment is intended for those interested in exploring the Remote
> Viewing capabilities of their Ghost Box's, EVP recorders. or even personal
> clairvoyant or precognitive capabilities And to maybe even have a little fun
> here.
>
> On Friday, 7/30/2010 I placed an object on top of my computer monitor,
> right in front of me, and will leave it there until noon Denver time on
> Monday, 8/2/2010. This experiment asks for participants to determine what
> that object is. Vague or partial answers won't be counted (for example, just
> giving a color, shape, size, what it's made of, etc): we're looking for what
> it is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Denver time Monday won't count.
> Participants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other means
> they chose. At the end of the experiment, I will reveal the object, and a
> tally of the number of correct and/or incorrect answers.
>
> In order to keep me honest, I have taken a picture of the object at the
> start of the experiment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder) of
> this group. The idea with this file is that you can download it now and
> 'keep it safe' on your computer. Then at the end of the experiment, I will
> post the password so you can reveal the contents of the file. That way, you
> were in control of the original image during the entire test, not me.
>
> Password pdf:
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100730.pdf
>
> And if you do not care to download the pdf file now, I will post the final
> image there at the end of the experiment anyway.
>
> My monitor is one of the older box-like SONY CRTs, and says "Trinitron" and
> "Multiscan 200sf" on the upper front. I have a couple monitors stacked in my
> closet too: they are not the monitors used in this experiment (they are not
> plugged in, and have nothing else on them anyway), and I have several
> laptops around: they are also not the monitors in this experiment. The
> monitor in this experiment is the only SONY monitor I have, says "SONY in
> various places on it, and can be seen in the following link from the first
> experiment, when the correct answer would have been "radio":
>
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.JPG
>
> Please post all answers to the group thread: that way, there will be a
> public record and I won't get accused of losing any answers. Any answers
> sent directly to me, I will repost on the public thread.
>
> 
>

I eally doub a Ghos Box is capable o emo e iewing.
 
F-S
